intro: Quararibea lecythicarpa, commonly known as the yellow-barked tree, is a tropical species native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by orange-red berries containing seeds. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
